title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices fell to 3,047.10 USD/T on February 5, 2026, down 0.17% from the previous day and 2.77% over the past month, though still 16.17% higher year-over-year. The price recently hit a 4-week low of 3031.00 USD/T. It retreated from a three-year high amid base metals pullback.

title: Aluminum Prices Soar to Four-Year High, Creating a Divide in U.S. Industry
summary: Aluminum futures on the LME reached four-year highs, with U.S. physical premiums exceeding $1 per pound, benefiting producers like Alcoa while straining downstream manufacturers. Goldman Sachs raised its H1 2026 forecast to $3,150 per ton amid supply constraints and tariffs. U.S. inventories have dropped sharply to under 300,000 tons.

title: Aluminum price hits $3,000 for first time since 2022 on supply concern
summary: Aluminum prices climbed above $3,000 a ton for the first time since 2022, reaching $3,015.50 amid tightening global supply from Chinese capacity caps and European energy constraints. Demand from construction and renewables supports the rally, with futures up 17% last year. Other base metals like copper and nickel also advanced.

title: SHFE Cast Aluminum Alloy Warrants Drop to 66,546 mt on Feb 5
summary: SHFE data indicates that on February 5, the total registered volume of cast aluminum alloy warrants decreased to 66,546 mt, down 245 mt from prior levels. This reflects ongoing adjustments in aluminum alloy inventory and market dynamics on the Shanghai Futures Exchange.

title: February 6, 2026 Jinshi Futures Morning Report: SHFE adjusts the
summary: Mysteel reports China's primary aluminum production in January 2026 reached 3.8385 million tons, up 3.24% year-on-year and 0.26% month-on-month, with average daily output at 123,800 tons. This preliminary data highlights steady growth in primary aluminum output amid market surveys.

title: LME aluminium cash offer slips 1.10% to USD 3014/t; opening stock down 0.44%
summary: LME aluminium cash prices fell 1.10% to USD 3014/t on February 5, with opening stocks declining 0.44% to 492,975 tonnes. Live warrants remained at 440,650 tonnes, signaling minor adjustments in global aluminum supply availability.

title: Vietnam-Backed Aluminum Project in Sekong Advances Toward 2028 Launch
summary: A Vietnam-Phuong Group aluminum smelting project in Laos' Sekong Province aims for 1 million tonnes annual capacity by 2028, focusing on bauxite mining in a USD 1 billion complex. Construction began in late 2022, with ministerial oversight on February 3 emphasizing sustainable development.

title: Century Aluminum Recasts Footprint With New Smelter Plans And ...
summary: Century Aluminum and Emirates Global Aluminium plan a major new aluminum smelter in Oklahoma, the first large-scale U.S. facility in nearly 50 years, while selling its Hawesville site for AI data redevelopment. These moves reshape production capacity and asset use amid rising stock performance.

title: Indonesia aluminum power demand projected to jump by 2028
summary: Indonesia's aluminum smelting industry is forecasted to significantly boost power demand by 2028 due to expanding production capacity. This projection underscores the sector's growing energy needs tied to smelter expansions.

title: Century Aluminum Backs New U.S. Smelter Built Around Next-Generation Smelting Technology
summary: Century Aluminum is partnering with Emirates Global Aluminum (EGA) to develop a new primary aluminum smelter in Inola, Oklahoma, using EGA's proprietary EX smelting technology. This next-generation technology aims to improve productivity, reduce energy consumption, and lower emissions, enhancing sustainability in U.S. aluminum production. The facility is expected to produce up to 750,000 metric tons annually, doubling current U.S. capacity and supporting key industries like automotive and aerospace.

title: Sustainability in Hydro
summary: Hydro emphasizes recycling post-consumer aluminum scrap to produce material with a carbon footprint 30 times lower than the industry average, as part of its strategy for zero-carbon production. The company has halved emissions since 1990 while doubling production and targets a 30% reduction by 2030 with emission-free smelting technology. Sustainability efforts include renewable energy, nature-positive practices, and a just transition for communities.

title: Can-ification: Aluminium's Role in Circular Packaging
summary: Aluminium cans are highlighted as one of the most trusted solutions for sustainable beverage packaging in a circular economy. The press release underscores their role in ongoing innovations for recyclability and environmental performance. This positions aluminum as a key material for sustainable packaging advancements.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel fell to 973 USD/T on February 5, 2026, down 0.31% from the previous day, though it has risen 4.62% over the past month and 31.49% year-over-year. The price is expected to trade at 986.72 USD/T by quarter-end and 1065.02 USD/T in 12 months. Updated data reflects ongoing market tracking as of February 6.

title: Steel Prices Rising Again? February 2026 Metal Market Update
summary: Steel prices continue to rise at mills with extended lead times, influenced by energy costs, winter weather, and lean inventory levels across the supply chain. The update discusses impacts on metal roofing contractors, including tight aluminum supply at four-year highs. Contractors are advised to manage risks for Q1 and Q2 projects amid pricing volatility.

title: What Contractors Need to Know About Metal Prices Right Now
summary: Steel market prices are rising at domestic mills with slightly increased production, but inventory constraints persist due to rushed orders and weather impacts. Energy costs and winter conditions affect supply, while aluminum hits four-year highs. Contractors should mitigate risks through supplier partnerships for upcoming projects.

title: Steel Stocks Rebound In 2026 | Demand, Prices, Margins In Focus
summary: Metal stocks are rebounding in early 2026 due to improving demand, stable pricing, easing input costs, and better margins after a subdued 2025. Steel prices rose 3% month-on-month in December, with HRC up 2%, followed by January hikes. Volumes and prices are expected to inch higher amid higher supply outlook.

title: China's spot prices hold steady as trading volume shrinks in steel market
summary: China's steel spot prices remain range-bound with low volatility as trading volumes shrink. The market is expected to consolidate with reduced activity. No specific price changes noted in the update.

title: ArcelorMittal sees 2% rise in steel sales
summary: ArcelorMittal forecasts a 2% increase in global steel demand this year excluding China, with production and shipments expected to grow across all regions in 2026 versus 2025 due to operational improvements and trade protections. In Europe, the company anticipates benefits from CBAM and new TRQ mechanisms helping domestic mills regain market share from imports. In 2025, sales fell to $61.35 billion while net income rose to $3.15 billion.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices fell to 3,079 CNY/T on February 6, 2026, with Chinese steel mills trimming production ahead of Lunar New Year, including pauses in blast furnaces and electric-arc furnaces for maintenance. Blast furnace utilization stayed above 86%, and daily hot metal output rose by 21,000 tons week-on-week. World Steel Association data indicates a decline in global steel supply in 2025 due to China's production cuts.

title: What Contractors Need to Know About Metal Prices Right Now - February 2026 Metal Roofing Market Update
summary: The update discusses rising steel mill prices, extended lead times, tight aluminum supply at four-year highs, and impacts from energy costs and winter weather on production. Inventory levels remain lean across the supply chain amid construction demand and interest rate effects. Contractors are advised to manage risks for Q1 and Q2 projects due to pricing volatility and backlogs.

title: February 6, 2026 Steel Market Summary – International Australia´s Bisalloy Steels Advances Further Onto World Stage
summary: Bisalloy Steels has secured CE certification for its structural grades, consolidating its global presence in Europe. The summary also covers New Zealand Steel's Glenbrook EAF project on track for a resurgent 2026, vital for the nation's economy. BlueScope Steel's new chief outlines the 2026 agenda amid economic pressures like RBA rate hikes.

title: ArcelorMittal produced 55.6 million tons of steel in 2025
summary: ArcelorMittal reduced its global steel production by 4% in 2025 compared to 2024, totaling 55.6 million tons. The decline was reported in the company's quarterly results. This reflects ongoing adjustments in the steel industry.

title: Signs Point to a Bright Future for U.S. Green Steel in 2026
summary: U.S. steel manufacturing is rebounding with innovations like lower-carbon electric arc mini-mills that recycle scrap steel, reducing reliance on coal and cutting emissions by 37% per ton since 1990. Startups such as Hertha Metals and Electra are advancing coal-free processes using renewable energy and chemical reactions, making production more efficient and cost-competitive than traditional methods or even Chinese production. These technologies promise full decarbonization, offsetting potential rises in emissions amid weakening federal protections.

title: Why 2026 could see momentum return to the steel technology transition
summary: After slower progress in recent years, the steel industry's shift away from fossil fuels is poised for renewed momentum in 2026. The article highlights accelerating advancements in low-carbon steel technologies. This transition aims to enhance sustainability while maintaining competitiveness.

title: Future of Steel: Trends, Technology & Sustainability 2026
summary: The article examines key trends in steel for 2026, focusing on sustainability, scrap recycling, and emerging low-carbon technologies. It discusses how these innovations are reshaping steel production to reduce environmental impact. Emphasis is placed on advancements driving greener manufacturing processes.

title: Steel Times International Issue January/February 2026
summary: This issue covers the impact of decarbonisation on the steel sector, alongside updates from India and China. A technology section notes momentum returning in steel innovations. It addresses sustainability challenges and advancements in the industry.

title: World Copper Prices Today, Thursday, February 5, 2026: Sideways around $5.80 per Pound
summary: World copper prices moved sideways around USD 5.80 per pound on February 5, 2026, following selling pressure and entering a consolidation phase. Market participants await macroeconomic sentiment and global industrial demand cues. Despite short-term bearish sentiment, long-term trends remain positive with a 30.29% yearly gain.

title: Copper Futures Decline Across Most Contracts on February 4, 2026
summary: Copper futures prices fell across most contracts on February 4, 2026, with the high-volume March contract closing at 5.9755 dollars per pound, down 0.1110. The February contract dropped modestly to 5.9855 dollars per pound. Trading volume was lower, and near-term contracts showed a downward trend.

title: Anglo American Lowers Production Target, Overnight SHFE and LME Copper Prices Fall Together [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: LME copper closed at $12,855/mt overnight on February 6, 2026, down 1.42% after a volatile session. SHFE copper fell then slightly rebounded, closing at 101,100 yuan/mt on February 5. Prices face pressure from rising US dollar index, inventory buildup, stable supply, and weak demand; further declines expected.

title: Comex Copper Settles 0.46% Lower at $5.7990 — Data Talk
summary: Front-month Comex copper for February delivery settled at $5.7990 on February 5, 2026, down 0.46% or 2.70 cents per pound. It marked the seventh lowest settlement this year and continued a downward trend over recent sessions. Year-to-date, prices are up 3.00%, off 6.10% from the 2026 high.

title: Trading was sluggish for spot copper during the day, with overall transactions limited [SMM Yangshan spot copper]
summary: Spot copper trading was sluggish on February 6, 2026, with limited transactions and warrant prices at $28-46/mt for February QP, flat from prior day. Overall market activity remained subdued amid ongoing price pressures.

title: Vale's copper ambition is to produce 1Mt/y
summary: Vale's base metals unit aims to produce one million tons of copper per year by developing existing assets. This target exceeds previous output goals for the company. The ambition highlights efforts to expand copper production capacity.

title: Anglo American Cuts 2027 Copper View, Warns of Continued Weak Diamond Market - Commodity Comment
summary: Anglo American revised its 2026 copper production guidance downward to 700,000-760,000 tonnes from 760,000-820,000 tonnes. The adjustment accounts for lower production levels at Collahuasi mine due to lower grade ore and refractory stockpiles through 2026. This reflects challenges in maintaining copper output.

title: Ero Copper's Record Output: Assessing the Commodity Balance & Liquidity Impact
summary: Ero Copper provided 2026 production guidance of 67,500–77,500 tonnes, indicating cautious growth after strong 2025 performance. This follows record output in Q4 2025, though gold production is expected to decline. The guidance assesses impacts on commodity balance and liquidity.

title: AWS to Source Low Carbon Nuton Copper from Rio Tinto for U.S. Data Center Infrastructure
summary: Rio Tinto and AWS have partnered under a two-year agreement for AWS to use Nuton copper in U.S. data center components. Nuton's technology uses naturally occurring microorganisms to extract copper from primary sulphide ores, eliminating traditional concentrators and smelters while reducing water use and emissions intensity compared to conventional methods.

title: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services collaborate to bring low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centres
summary: Rio Tinto and AWS have entered a two-year collaboration agreement where AWS will use the first Nuton copper produced in components of its U.S. data centres. The partnership combines industrial innovation with cloud technology to deliver cleaner, lower-carbon materials at scale.

title: Momentum Technologies advances dual-track US processing for rare earths and battery materials
summary: Momentum Technologies has commissioned a demonstration plant near Dallas, Texas with proprietary membrane solvent extraction (MSX) technology that compresses traditional solvent extraction into compact membrane reactors. The facility can process both battery materials and rare earth elements, with rare earth commissioning expected in mid-February 2026.

title: Nickel Prices Soar on Supply, Geopolitical Concerns Amid Surplus Risks
summary: During the night session on January 6, 2026, SHFE nickel prices soared due to expectations of supply tightening policies in Indonesia and geopolitical concerns. Despite the price rise, spot transactions remain weak with limited downstream acceptance, and inventories are slightly building up. Smelters are increasing production, raising risks of future surplus amid unchanged demand.

title: LME nickel prices surpass $17000, reaching 15-month high
summary: LME nickel futures closed at US$17,003/ton on January 5, 2026, marking the highest level since October 2024. This surge reflects strengthening market sentiment for the metal used in batteries and stainless steel.

title: Nickel price spikes more than 10% as Chinese buying fuels metals surge
summary: Nickel prices spiked over 10% in London, hitting $18,785/ton, driven by Chinese investor buying and production risks in Indonesia despite oversupply. This extends a 30% rally since mid-December, reviving the LME nickel contract after past challenges. Broader base metals like copper and tin also surged amid high-volume Asian trading.

title: Indonesia cuts 2026 nickel quota, global prices jump immediately
summary: Indonesia's reduction in its 2026 nickel production quota has sparked supply concerns, causing an immediate jump in global nickel prices. This policy shift counters ongoing oversupply issues in the market.

title: Nickel price extends drop amid lack of detail on Indonesia output cuts
summary: Nickel prices fell further from a 19-month high after Indonesia failed to provide details on its pledged output cuts, leading to a decline of up to 5.9% in three-month futures on the London Metal Exchange. Indonesia's Energy and Mineral Resources Ministry stated that nickel mining quotas for the year are still being finalized. The lack of specifics has raised uncertainty about the sustainability of recent price rallies fueled by supply concerns.

title: Vale's 2025 nickel output powered by Onça Puma mine's expansion
summary: Vale anticipates increased nickel production in 2025 driven by the expansion of its Onça Puma mine. For 2026, the company has set nickel production targets between 175,000 and 200,000 tons. This expansion supports Vale's growth strategy in nickel output.

title: Ivanhoe Electric Plans Expanded Copper, Nickel Exploration in Côte d'Ivoire in 2026
summary: Ivanhoe Electric and partner Sama Resources plan to accelerate copper and nickel exploration at the Samapleu-Grata project in Côte d'Ivoire starting in February 2026 with a 4,500-meter diamond drilling campaign across 20 targets. A 2024 study estimates potential production of over 887,000 tonnes of nickel concentrate and 621,000 tonnes of copper concentrate over a 16-year mine life. The initiative aims to demonstrate the project's district-scale potential amid global demand for critical minerals.

title: Indonesia cuts 2026 nickel quota, global prices jump immediately
summary: Indonesia has reduced its 2026 nickel production quota, sparking immediate concerns over global supply shortages. This decision has driven a sharp increase in global nickel prices. The quota cut highlights ongoing efforts to balance supply and demand in the nickel market.

title: Robin Zeng: Unlocking the Sustainable Energy Era with Zero-Carbon Technology
summary: Dr. Robin Zeng, Chairman and CEO of CATL, discussed the future of sustainable energy, highlighting CATL's achievements in renewable energy deployment and circular economy initiatives. The company has achieved industry-leading recovery rates of 99.6% for nickel and cobalt, and is developing innovative grid-forming energy storage technology to stabilize zero-carbon power systems.

title: Ivanhoe Electric Plans Expanded Copper, Nickel Exploration in Côte d'Ivoire in 2026
summary: Ivanhoe Electric plans to accelerate copper and nickel exploration at the Samapleu-Grata project in Côte d'Ivoire, launching a 4,500-meter diamond drilling campaign across 20 strategic targets starting in February. A 2024 study estimates the project could produce 887,414 tonnes of nickel concentrate over a mine life of 16.1 years.

title: Green Nickel, Global Future
summary: Neo Energy is redefining Indonesia's nickel sector through sustainable integration of mining, processing, and industrial development across 12,000 hectares of nickel mines. The company is constructing a high-pressure acid leach facility targeted for completion in 2029 and operating two industrial parks powered entirely by green energy.

title: Tenaris supports HRSG projects worldwide to meet rising electricity demand
summary: In 2025, Tenaris secured agreements for 15 HRSG (heat recovery steam generator) projects in partnership with Vogt Power and Nooter Eriksen, totaling more than 17,000 tons of pipes with lengths ranging from 22 to 26 meters. Pipes for these projects are being produced at Silcotub, Tenaris's steel pipe mill in Romania, with production requiring strict adherence to tight schedules and demanding technical specifications.

title: Tenaris in Italy achieves ASME certification for the supply of materials for the nuclear sector
summary: Dalmine, Tenaris's seamless steel pipe mill in Italy, has obtained ASME III certification for supplying materials to nuclear facilities. This certification is essential for accessing the global nuclear market and supporting both new nuclear plant construction and maintenance of existing facilities as part of the energy transition.

title: Advancing power generation: Tenaris in dialogue with Macchi at Hydrogen Expo 2025
summary: Tenaris participated in the Hydrogen Expo 2025 in Piacenza, Italy, discussing steel solutions for power generation with Macchi, a global leader in industrial boiler design. The company highlighted its 25-year partnership with Sofinter Group and its investments in manufacturing capabilities, including high-performance steels and products like Thor® 115 for extreme operating conditions.

title: Prysmian Group Data Breach in 2026 - Breachsense
summary: Prysmian Group, an Italy-based multinational cable manufacturing company, suffered a data breach on February 05, 2026. The threat actor 0APT claimed responsibility, with a leak size of 14TB affecting prysmian.com. The company produces underground, submarine, industrial energy cables, optical fibers, and telecom systems worldwide.
